main event: A report from Wright-Patterson Flight Service Center on an unidentified flying object observed over Columbus, Ohio on 19 July 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as luminous and of a flying wing type with swept-back wings., The object was observed to be moving very fast with a humming noise emanating from it., The sighting occurred in clear weather conditions with visibility of 15 miles., The observer was a photographer with experience working with jet aircraft and engines., There were no photographs or sketches included in the report.
sighted object: one luminous flying wing type object
witness description: a photographer with experience in aircraft
